Liberal political theory aims to define and delimit the role of the state in a democratic society, as well as establish a coherent and just framework for individual rights and freedoms. The question of whether the conceptions of justice offered by this theory are adequate is a complex one, as it encompasses various aspects of political philosophy.

One of the key tenets of liberal political theory is the idea of individual autonomy, or the ability of individuals to make decisions for themselves without undue interference from the state or others. This concept is essential in establishing a just society, as it allows individuals to live according to their own beliefs and pursue their own goals. However, some argue that this focus on individual autonomy can lead to a lack of concern for the greater good or the collective welfare.
